result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda M Blaes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Huber for counseling and child care, can serve on electronic monitor, if eligible according to local jail rules. - stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay Restitution $651.17 to Shopko in Plover.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Probation can be transferred to Wood County and DNA sample can be taken at Wood County.
Not to be on the premises of Shopko.
Do not own or maintain a checking account; do not issue or negotiate any checks, unless approved by the Agent.
Early Discharge, if successfully completes.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda M Blaes in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. DA Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

DA Molepske makes sentencing recommendation to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs with joint recommendation and request probation to transfer to Wood County, request Agent discretion if community service. 
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:**PROBATION**
I/S sentence: 60 days jail, with huber for counseling and child care, can serve on electronic monitor, if eligible according to local jail rules. - stayed
12 months probation, can be transferred to Wood County and DNA sample can be taken at Wood County.
Conditions:
Pay Restitution $651.17 to Shopko in Plover.
Not to be on the premises of Shopko.
 Do not own or maintain a checking account; do not issue or negotiate any checks, unless approved by the Agent.
Early Discharge, if successfully completes.
Pay costs, sucharges, including DNA surcharge.

Not ordering community service.
Appeal rights provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 23, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Amanda M Blaes in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:42 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

This matter had been set for a plea and sentencing last week. Defendant failed to appear and Court entered warrant.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is vacated.

Atty Halverson addresses the Court, has an updated address.
There is a resolution and plea will be pushed out, for Defendant to have time to get restitution paid.

Address has been updated.

Defendant's last name is now Berndsen.

Atty Knaapen has no objection to signature bond being reinstated.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 10:15 am.
